ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Do not give out of a desire for gain.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Do not bestow favours in expectation of return,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and bestow not favour in order to seek from others a greater return,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and do not think that by doing such deeds, you have done a great favor to God.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And do not favour others in order to receive more.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And give not a thing in order to have more.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And bestow not favors that you may receive again with increase,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Give not, thinking to gain greater
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And show not favour, seeking wordly gain!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: do not bestow a favour in the expectation of receiving more in return;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And bestow not favour that thou mayest receive more.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Do not grant a favour seeking a greater gain,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Nor expect, in giving, any increase (for thyself)!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And give not a thing in order to have more (or consider not your deeds of Allah's obedience as a favour to Allah).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Do not give, thinking to gain greater
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And show no favor seeking gain.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And do not confer favor to acquire more
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [74:6] And do not grant a favour seeking greater gain (read tastakthiru as a circumstantial qualifier) in other words, do not give something in order to demand more in return: this [stipulation] is specific to the Prophet (s), since he is enjoined to [adopt] the fairest traits and the noblest of manners;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And show not favour, seeking worldly gain!) such that you give a little and receive instead what is more and better in the life of the world; it is also said this means: do not deem the works you do for Allah to be too much.
